alert.note: Alert for Essex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 12 at 3:46AM EST until December 14 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Shawsheen River At Andover affecting Essex County. For the Shawsheen River...including Andover...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Shawsheen River at Andover. * WHEN...From late tonight to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Floodwaters encroach on very lowest lying business parking lots off of Route 114 in Lawrence and North Andover that are adjacent to the Shawsheen River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 27.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 29.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 29.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.4 feet on 03/16/2023. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM EST.
